items.description: Summary information for an authentication provider.

active_server.description: The server the provider is using to serve authentication requests. Null if no server is set or is not applicable for that provider.

forest.description: The active directory forest. Null if not applicable.

id.description: The ID of the provider.

site.description: The active directory forest. Null if not applicable.

type.description: The type of provider.

action_email_address.description: Email a specific email address when rule matches.

action_email_owner.description: Email quota domain owner when rule matches.

email_template.description: Path of optional /ifs template file used for email actions.

holdoff.description: Time to wait between detections for rules triggered by user actions.

schedule.description: Schedule for rules that repeatedly notify.

action_email_owner.description: Email quota domain owner when rule matches.

id.description: The system ID given to the rule.

container.description: If true, SMB shares using the quota directory see the quota thresholds as share size.

enforced.description: True if the quota provides enforcement, otherwise a accounting quota.

linked.description: If false and the quota is linked, attempt to unlink.

thresholds_include_overhead.description: If true, thresholds apply to data plus filesystem overhead required to store the data (i.e. 'physical' usage).

container.description: If true, SMB shares using the quota directory see the quota thresholds as share size.

enforced.description: True if the quota provides enforcement, otherwise a accounting quota.

force.description: Force creation of quotas on the root of /ifs.

include_snapshots.description: If true, quota governs snapshot data as well as head data.

persona.description: A persona consists of either a 'type' and 'name' or a 'ID'.

thresholds_include_overhead.description: If true, thresholds apply to data plus filesystem overhead required to store the data (i.e. 'physical' usage).

type.description: The type of quota.

container.description: If true, SMB shares using the quota directory see the quota thresholds as share size.

enforced.description: True if the quota provides enforcement, otherwise a accounting quota.

id.description: The system ID given to the quota.

include_snapshots.description: If true, quota governs snapshot data as well as head data.

linked.description: For user and group quotas, true if the quota is linked and controlled by a parent default-* quota. Linked quotas cannot be modified until they are unlinked.

notifications.description: Summary of notifications: 'custom' indicates one or more notification rules available from the notifications sub-resource; 'default' indicates system default rules are used; 'disabled' indicates that no notifications will be used for this quota.

persona.description: A persona consists of either a 'type' and 'name' or a 'ID'.

ready.description: True if the accounting is accurate on the quota.  If false, this quota is waiting on completion of a QuotaScan job.

thresholds_include_overhead.description: If true, thresholds apply to data plus filesystem overhead required to store the data (i.e. 'physical' usage).

type.description: The type of quota.

advisory.description: Usage bytes at which notifications will be sent but writes will not be denied.

hard.description: Usage bytes at which further writes will be denied.

soft.description: Usage bytes at which notifications will be sent and soft grace time will be started.

soft_grace.description: Time in seconds after which the soft threshold has been hit before writes will be denied.

advisory_exceeded.description: True if the advisory threshold has been hit.

advisory_last_exceeded.description: Time at which advisory threshold was hit.

hard_exceeded.description: True if the hard threshold has been hit.

hard_last_exceeded.description: Time at which hard threshold was hit.

soft_exceeded.description: True if the soft threshold has been hit.

soft_last_exceeded.description: Time at which soft threshold was hit

inodes.description: Number of inodes (filesystem entities) used by governed data.

logical.description: Apparent bytes used by governed data.

physical.description: Bytes used for governed data and filesystem overhead.

resume.description: Continue returning results from previous call using this token (token should come from the previous call, resume cannot be used with other options).

linked_quotas_count.description: Total number of user and group totals that are linked.

resume.description: Continue returning results from previous call using this token (token should come from the previous call, resume cannot be used with other options).

email_customer_on_failure.description: Email the customer if all trasmission methods fail.

primary_esrs_gateway.description: Primary ESRS Gateway. Necessary to enable ConnectEMC.

remote_support_subnet.description: Network subnet to use for remote support.  Necessary to enable ConnectEMC.

secondary_esrs_gateway.description: Secondary ESRS Gateway. Used if Primary is unavailable.

use_smtp_failover.description: Use SMPT if primary and secondary gateways are unavailable.

generated.description: Whether report was manually requested (live) or scheduled.

id.description: The system ID given to the report.

time.description: Unix epoch time the report was taken.

type.description: Whether this is a summary or detail report.

action.description: The action to be taken by this job.

ads_streams_replicated.description: The number of ads streams replicated by this job.

block_specs_replicated.description: The number of block specs replicated by this job.

bytes_recoverable.description: The number of bytes recoverable by this job.

bytes_transferred.description: The number of bytes that have been transferred by this job.

char_specs_replicated.description: The number of char specs replicated by this job.

corrected_lins.description: The number of LINs corrected by this job.

dead_node.description: This field is true if the node running this job is dead.

dirs_changed.description: The number of directories changed by this job.

dirs_deleted.description: The number of directories deleted by this job.

dirs_moved.description: The number of directories moved by this job.

dirs_new.description: The number of directories created by this job.

duration.description: The amount of time in seconds between when the job was started and when it ended.  If the job has not yet ended, this is the amount of time since the job started.  This field is null if the job has not yet started.

end_time.description: The time the job ended in unix epoch seconds. The field is null if the job hasn't ended.

error.description: The primary error message for this job.

error_checksum_files_skipped.description: The number of files with checksum errors skipped by this job.

error_io_files_skipped.description: The number of files with io errors skipped by this job.

error_net_files_skipped.description: The number of files with network errors skipped by this job.

errors.description: A list of error messages for this job.

failed_chunks.description: Tyhe number of data chunks that failed transmission.

fifos_replicated.description: The number of fifos replicated by this job.

file_data_bytes.description: The number of bytes tranferred that belong to files.

files_changed.description: The number of files changed by this job.

files_linked.description: The number of files linked by this job.

files_new.description: The number of files created by this job.

files_selected.description: The number of files selected by this job.

files_transferred.description: The number of files transfered by this job.

files_unlinked.description: The number of files unlinked by this job.

files_with_ads_replicated.description: The number of files with ads replicated by this job.

flipped_lins.description: The number of LINs flipped by this job.

hard_links_replicated.description: The number of hard links replicated by this job.

hash_exceptions_fixed.description: The number of hash exceptions fixed by this job.

hash_exceptions_found.description: The number of hash exceptions found by this job.

id.description: A unique identifier for this object.

lins_total.description: The number of LINs tranferred by this job.

network_bytes_to_source.description: The total number of bytes sent to the source by this job.

network_bytes_to_target.description: The total number of bytes sent to the target by this job.

new_files_replicated.description: The number of new files replicated by this job.

num_retransmitted_files.description: The number of files that have been retransmitted by this job.

phases.description: Data for each phase of this job.

policy_action.description: This is the action the policy is configured to perform.

regular_files_replicated.description: The number of regular files replicated by this job.

resynced_lins.description: The number of LINs resynched by this job.

retransmitted_files.description: The files that have been retransmitted by this job.

retry.description: The number of times the job has been retried.

running_chunks.description: The number of data chunks currently being transmitted.

sockets_replicated.description: The number of sockets replicated by this job.

source_bytes_recovered.description: The number of bytes recovered on the source.

source_directories_created.description: The number of directories created on the source.

source_directories_deleted.description: The number of directories deleted on the source.

source_directories_linked.description: The number of directories linked on the source.

source_directories_unlinked.description: The number of directories unlinked on the source.

source_directories_visited.description: The number of directories visited on the source.

source_files_deleted.description: The number of files deleted on the source.

source_files_linked.description: The number of files linked on the source.

source_files_unlinked.description: The number of files unlinked on the source.

action.description: If 'copy', source files will be copied to the target cluster.  If 'sync', the target directory will be made an image of the source directory:  Files and directories that have been deleted on the source, have been moved within the target directory, or no longer match the selection criteria will be deleted from the target directory.

file_matching_pattern.description: A file matching pattern, organized as an OR'ed set of AND'ed file criteria, for example ((a AND b) OR (x AND y)) used to define a set of files with specific properties.  Policies of type 'sync' cannot use 'path' or time criteria in their matching patterns, but policies of type 'copy' can use all listed criteria.

name.description: User-assigned name of this sync policy.

source_exclude_directories.description: Directories that will be excluded from the sync.  Modifying this field will result in a full synchronization of all data.

source_include_directories.description: Directories that will be included in the sync.  Modifying this field will result in a full synchronization of all data.

source_root_path.description: The root directory on the source cluster the files will be synced from.  Modifying this field will result in a full synchronization of all data.

target_host.description: Hostname or IP address of sync target cluster.  Modifying the target cluster host can result in the policy being unrunnable if the new target does not match the current target association.

target_path.description: Absolute filesystem path on the target cluster for the sync destination.

or_criteria.description: An array containing objects with "and_criteria" properties, each set of and_criteria will be logically OR'ed together to create the full file matching pattern.

and_criteria.description: An array containing individual file criterion objects each describing one criterion.  These are logically AND'ed together to form a set of criteria.

items.description: An object describing one criterion for finding a matching file, for example "size is greater than or equal to 10KB". Note: For time types (accessed_*, birth_*, and changed_*), operator is not required (it is implicitly ==).  For the value, you can use a relative date and time, such as "two weeks ago", or specific date and time, such as "January 1, 2012."  Time settings are based on a 24-hour clock.

attribute_exists.description: For "custom_attribute" type criteria.  The file will match as long as the attribute named by "field" exists.  Default is true.

case_sensitive.description: If true, the value comparison will be case sensitive.  Default is true.

field.description: The name of the file attribute to match on (only required if this is a custom_attribute type criterion).  Default is an empty string "".

operator.description: How to compare the specified attribute of each file to the specified value.

type.description: The type of this criterion, that is, which file attribute to match on.

value.description: The value to compare the specified attribute of each file to.

whole_word.description: If true, the attribute must match the entire word.  Default is true.

connected.description: Whether there is a connection between the source and target.

last_split.description: The last time a network split occurred.

last_work.description: The last time the worker performed work.

process_id.description: The process ID of the worker.

source_host.description: The source host for this worker.

target_host.description: The target host for this worker.

resume.description: Continue returning results from previous call using this token (token should come from the previous call, resume cannot be used with other options).

action.description: If 'copy', source files will be copied to the target cluster.  If 'sync', the target directory will be made an image of the source directory:  Files and directories that have been deleted on the source, have been moved within the target directory, or no longer match the selection criteria will be deleted from the target directory.

burst_mode.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of Isilon support.  Enable/disable UDP-based data transfer.

changelist.description: If true, retain previous source snapshot and incremental repstate, both of which are required for changelist creation.

check_integrity.description: If true, the sync target performs cyclic redundancy checks (CRC) on the data as it is received.

conflicted.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of Isilon support.  If true, the most recent run of this policy encountered an error and this policy will not start any more scheduled jobs until this field is manually set back to 'false'.

description.description: User-assigned description of this sync policy.

disable_file_split.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of Isilon support.  If true, the 7.2+ file splitting capability will be disabled.

disable_fofb.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of Isilon support.  Enable/disable sync failover/failback.

disable_stf.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of Isilon support.  Enable/disable the 6.5+ STF based data transfer and uses only treewalk.

enabled.description: If true, jobs will be automatically run based on this policy, according to its schedule.

expected_dataloss.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of Isilon support.  Continue sending files even with the corrupted filesystem.

file_matching_pattern.description: A file matching pattern, organized as an OR'ed set of AND'ed file criteria, for example ((a AND b) OR (x AND y)) used to define a set of files with specific properties.  Policies of type 'sync' cannot use 'path' or time criteria in their matching patterns, but policies of type 'copy' can use all listed criteria.

force_interface.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of Isilon support.  Determines whether data is sent only through the subnet and pool specified in the "source_network" field. This option can be useful if there are multiple interfaces for the given source subnet.  If you enable this option, the net.inet.ip.choose_ifa_by_ipsrc sysctl should be set.

log_level.description: Severity an event must reach before it is logged.

log_removed_files.description: If true, the system will log any files or directories that are deleted due to a sync.

name.description: User-assigned name of this sync policy.

password.description: The password for the target cluster.  This field is not readable.

report_max_age.description: Length of time (in seconds) a policy report will be stored.

report_max_count.description: Maximum number of policy reports that will be stored on the system.

restrict_target_network.description: If you specify true, and you specify a SmartConnect zone in the "target_host" field, replication policies will connect only to nodes in the specified SmartConnect zone.  If you specify false, replication policies are not restricted to specific nodes on the target cluster.

schedule.description: The schedule on which new jobs will be run for this policy.

skip_lookup.description: Skip DNS lookup of target IPs.

last_job_state.description: This is the state of the most recent job for this policy.

last_success.description: Timestamp of last known successfully completed syncronization.  Value is null if the policy has never completed successfully.

log_level.description: Severity an event must reach before it is logged.

log_removed_files.description: If true, the system will log any files or directories that are deleted due to a sync.

name.description: User-assigned name of this sync policy.

next_run.description: This is the next time a job is scheduled to run for this policy in Unix epoch seconds.  This field is null if the job is not scheduled.

report_max_age.description: Length of time (in seconds) a policy report will be stored.

report_max_count.description: Maximum number of policy reports that will be stored on the system.

restrict_target_network.description: If you specify true, and you specify a SmartConnect zone in the "target_host" field, replication policies will connect only to nodes in the specified SmartConnect zone.  If you specify false, replication policies are not restricted to specific nodes on the target cluster.

schedule.description: The schedule on which new jobs will be run for this policy.

source_exclude_directories.description: Directories that will be excluded from the sync.  Modifying this field will result in a full synchronization of all data.

source_include_directories.description: Directories that will be included in the sync.  Modifying this field will result in a full synchronization of all data.

source_network.description: Restricts replication policies on the local cluster to running on the specified subnet and pool.

source_root_path.description: The root directory on the source cluster the files will be synced from.  Modifying this field will result in a full synchronization of all data.

source_snapshot_archive.description: If true, archival snapshots of the source data will be taken on the source cluster before a sync.

source_snapshot_expiration.description: The length of time in seconds to keep snapshots on the source cluster.

source_snapshot_pattern.description: The name pattern for snapshots taken on the source cluster before a sync.

target_compare_initial_sync.description: If true, the target creates diffs against the original sync.

target_detect_modifications.description: If true, target cluster will detect if files have been changed on the target by legacy tree walk syncs.

target_host.description: Hostname or IP address of sync target cluster.  Modifying the target cluster host can result in the policy being unrunnable if the new target does not match the current target association.

target_path.description: Absolute filesystem path on the target cluster for the sync destination.

target_snapshot_alias.description: The alias of the snapshot taken on the target cluster after the sync completes. A value of @DEFAULT will reset this field to the default creation value.

target_snapshot_archive.description: If true, archival snapshots of the target data will be taken on the target cluster after successful sync completions.

target_snapshot_expiration.description: The length of time in seconds to keep snapshots on the target cluster.

target_snapshot_pattern.description: The name pattern for snapshots taken on the target cluster after the sync completes.  A value of @DEFAULT will reset this field to the default creation value.

workers_per_node.description: The number of worker threads on a node performing a sync.

action.description: If 'copy', source files will be copied to the target cluster.  If 'sync', the target directory will be made an image of the source directory:  Files and directories that have been deleted on the source, have been moved within the target directory, or no longer match the selection criteria will be deleted from the target directory.

burst_mode.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of Isilon support.  Enable/disable UDP-based data transfer.

changelist.description: If true, retain previous source snapshot and incremental repstate, both of which are required for changelist creation.

check_integrity.description: If true, the sync target performs cyclic redundancy checks (CRC) on the data as it is received.

conflicted.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of Isilon support.  If true, the most recent run of this policy encountered an error and this policy will not start any more scheduled jobs until this field is manually set back to 'false'.

description.description: User-assigned description of this sync policy.

disable_file_split.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of Isilon support.  If true, the 7.2+ file splitting capability will be disabled.

disable_fofb.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of Isilon support.  Enable/disable sync failover/failback.

disable_stf.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of Isilon support.  Enable/disable the 6.5+ STF based data transfer and uses only treewalk.

enabled.description: If true, jobs will be automatically run based on this policy, according to its schedule.

expected_dataloss.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of Isilon support.  Continue sending files even with the corrupted filesystem.

file_matching_pattern.description: A file matching pattern, organized as an OR'ed set of AND'ed file criteria, for example ((a AND b) OR (x AND y)) used to define a set of files with specific properties.  Policies of type 'sync' cannot use 'path' or time criteria in their matching patterns, but policies of type 'copy' can use all listed criteria.

force_interface.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of Isilon support. If you enable this option, the net.inet.ip.choose_ifa_by_ipsrc sysctl should be set.

autocommit_offset.description: The autocommit time period in seconds for the domain.  After a file exists in this domain without being modified for the specified time period, the file is automatically committed the next time the file is accessed.  If null, there is no autocommit time so files must be manually committed.

override_date.description: Override retention date for the domain.  If this date is later than any committed file's own retention date, that file will remain protected beyond its own retention date until this date.

privileged_delete.description: If 'on', files in this domain can be deleted using the privileged delete feature.  Otherwise, they can't be deleted even with privileged delete.  If 'disabled', privileged file deletes are permanently disabled and cannot be turned back on again.

type.description: Whether this is an enterprise domain or this is a compliance domain. Compliance domains may not be created on enterprise clusters. Enterprise and compliance domains may be created on compliance clusters.

path.description: Root path of this domain.  Files in this directory and all sub-directories will be protected.

id.description: System-assigned ID of this protection domain.

incomplete.description: If true, OneFS is still in the process of creating this domain and it is not yet preventing files from being modified or deleted.  If false, the domain is fully created and operational.

lin.description: Logical inode number (LIN) for the root of this domain.

max_modifies.description: Maximum number of times a WORM domain can be modified over its lifetime.

path.description: Root path of this domain.  Files in this directory and all sub-directories will be protected.

privileged_delete.description: If 'on', files in this domain can be deleted using the privileged delete feature.  Otherwise, they can't be deleted even with privileged delete.  If 'disabled', privileged file deletes are permanently disabled and cannot be turned back on again.

total_modifies.description: The number of times this domain has been modified (had its domain attributes changed) so far.  A WORM domain can be modified a fixed number of times over its lifetime defined by max_modifies.

type.description: Whether this is an enterprise domain or this is a compliance domain. Compliance domains may not be created on enterprise clusters. Enterprise and compliance domains may be created on compliance clusters.

cdate.description: To set the compliance clock to the current system time, PUT to this resource with an empty JSON object {} for the cdate value.  This cluster must be in compliance mode to set the compliance clock.

The current time of the SmartLock compliance clock in Unix epoch seconds, or null if the compliance clock is not set.  To set the compliance clock to the current system time, PUT to this resource with an empty JSON object {} for the cdate value.  This cluster must be in compliance mode to set the compliance clock.
